post.description: Lists your dedicated IPs.

200.description: An array of dedicated IP information

post.description: Retrieves information about a single dedicated IP.
Requests an additional dedicated IP for your account. Accounts may have one outstanding request at any time, and provisioning requests are processed within 24 hours.

warmup.description: Whether to enable warmup mode for the IP

pool.description: The ID of the pool to add the dedicated IP to, or null to use your account's default pool

200.description: A description of the provisioning request that was created

500.description: Server error (IP provision limit, no sending history, poor reputation)

post.description: Begins the warmup process for a dedicated IP. During the warmup process, Mandrill will gradually increase the percentage of your mail that is sent over the warming-up IP, over a period of roughly 30 days. The rest of your mail will be sent over shared IPs or other dedicated IPs in the same pool.
Cancels the warmup process for a dedicated IP.
Moves a dedicated IP to a different pool.

pool.description: The name of the new pool to add the dedicated IP to

create_pool.description: Whether to create the pool if it does not exist; if false and the pool does not exist, an Unknown_Pool will be thrown

200.description: Information about the updated state of the dedicated IP

post.description: Deletes a dedicated IP. This is permanent and cannot be undone.

ip.description: The dedicated IP to remove from your account

200.description: A description of the IP that was removed from your account

post.description: Lists your dedicated IP pools.

200.description: The dedicated IP pools for your account, up to a maximum of 1,000

post.description: Describes a single dedicated IP pool.

200.description: Information about the dedicated IP pool

post.description: Creates a pool and returns it. If a pool already exists with this name, no action will be performed.

pool.description: The name of a pool to create

200.description: Information about the dedicated IP pool

post.description: Deletes a pool. A pool must be empty before you can delete it, and you cannot delete your default pool.

pool.description: The name of a pool to delete

400.description: Cannot delete default pool or non-empty pool

Adds an email to your email rejection blacklist. Addresses that you add manually will never expire and there is no reputation penalty for removing them from your blacklist. Attempting to blacklist an address that has been whitelisted will have no effect.

200.description: Email successfully added to rejection blacklist

post.description: Retrieves your email rejection blacklist. You can provide an email address to limit the results. Returns up to 1000 results. By default, entries that have expired are excluded from the results; set include_expired to true to include them.
Deletes an email rejection. There is no limit to how many rejections you can remove from your blacklist, but keep in mind that each deletion has an affect on your reputation.

200.description: Email successfully deleted from rejection blacklist

404.description: Email not found in rejection list or unknown subaccount

Checks the SPF and DKIM settings for a domain. If it isn't already added to your account, it will be added automatically.

id.description: Unique identifier of the subaccount to resume

post.summary: Send a new transactional message through the Transactional API.
post.description:
Send a new transactional message through Mandrill
Note
If you signed up for a Mandrill account on or after December 1st, 2015, you must add SPF and DKIM records and verify ownership of your sending domains before you can send email through your account. Mandrill will not send any email from unverified domains or domains without valid SPF and DKIM records, including public domains like gmail.com, yahoo.com, and more.

Custom signing domains are only available to Mandrill accounts created before December 1st, 2015. If you signed up for a new Mandrill account on or after December 1st, 2015, the signing_domain parameter will be ignored.

Mail sent from unverified domains or domains without valid SPF and DKIM records will be rejected with the reject_reason, unsigned.

Learn more about SPF and DKIM, and domain verification

200.description: an array of objects for each recipient containing the key "email" with the email address, and details of the message status for that recipient

post.summary: Send a new transactional message using a template
post.description: Send a new transactional message using a template. If you signed up for a Mandrill account on or after December 1st, 2015, you must add SPF and DKIM records and verify ownership of your sending domains before you can send email through your account. Mandrill will not send any email from unverified domains or domains without valid SPF and DKIM records, including public domains like gmail.com, yahoo.com, and more. Custom signing domains are only available to Mandrill accounts created before December 1st, 2015. If you signed up for a new Mandrill account on or after December 1st, 2015, the signing_domain parameter will be ignored. Mail sent from unverified domains or domains without valid SPF and DKIM records will be rejected with the reject_reason, unsigned.

Search recently sent messages and optionally narrow by date range, tags, senders, and API keys. Results can include both email and SMS messages. If no date range is specified, results within the last 7 days are returned.

200.description: Messages matching the search query (can include both email and SMS messages)

post.summary: Get time series data for message search
post.description: Search the content of recently sent messages and return the aggregated hourly stats for matching messages.

post.summary: Get information about a single sent message
post.description: Returns detailed information about a single sent message. Can return either email or SMS message information depending on the message type.

200.description: Information about the message (email or SMS)

post.summary: Get the full content of a sent message
post.description: Returns the full content of a recently sent message. For email messages, includes HTML, text, and attachments. For SMS messages, includes text content and SMS-specific fields.

200.description: The content of the message (email or SMS)

post.description: Parse the full MIME document for an email message, returning the content of the message broken into its constituent pieces.

post.summary: Send a raw MIME message through Mandrill

opens.description: Number of times emails were opened

date_to.description: End date as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

states.description: Array of message states to narrow the export to; messages with ANY of the states will be included

items.description: An API key associated with your account

id.description: a scheduled email id, as returned by any of the messages/send calls or messages/list-scheduled
the unique id of the message to get - passed as the "_id" field in webhooks, send calls, or search calls

raw_message.example:
From: sender@example.com

RequestComponent.title: Message
RequestComponent.description: Mandrill message payload for transactional email

html.description: the full HTML content to be sent

text.description: optional full text content to be sent

from_name.description: optional from name to be used

email.description: The email address of the recipient

name.description: The optional display name to use for the recipient

type.description: the header type to use for the recipient, defaults to "to" if not provided Possible values: "to", "cc", or "bcc".

headers.description: optional extra headers to add to the message (most headers are allowed)

important.description: whether or not this message is important, and should be delivered ahead of non-important messages

track_opens.description: whether or not to turn on open tracking for the message

track_clicks.description: whether or not to turn on click tracking for the message

auto_text.description: whether or not to automatically generate a text part for messages that are not given text

auto_html.description: whether or not to automatically generate an HTML part for messages that are not given HTML

inline_css.description: whether or not to automatically inline all CSS styles provided in the message HTML - only for HTML documents less than 256KB in size

url_strip_qs.description: whether or not to strip the query string from URLs when aggregating tracked URL data

preserve_recipients.description: whether or not to expose all recipients in to "To" header for each email

view_content_link.description: set to false to remove content logging for sensitive emails

bcc_address.description: an optional address to receive an exact copy of each recipient's email

tracking_domain.description: a custom domain to use for tracking opens and clicks instead of mandrillapp.com

signing_domain.description: a custom domain to use for SPF/DKIM signing instead of mandrill (for "via" or "on behalf of" in email clients)

return_path_domain.description: a custom domain to use for the messages's return-path

merge.description: whether to evaluate merge tags in the message. Will automatically be set to true if either merge_vars or global_merge_vars are provided.

merge_language.description: the merge tag language to use when evaluating merge tags, either mailchimp or handlebars Possible values: "mailchimp" or "handlebars".

global_merge_vars.description: global merge variables to use for all recipients. You can override these per recipient.

merge_vars.description: per-recipient merge variables, which override global merge variables with the same name.

tags.description: an array of string to tag the message with. Stats are accumulated using tags, though we only store the first 100 we see, so this should not be unique or change frequently. Tags should be 50 characters or less. Any tags starting with an underscore are reserved for internal use and will cause errors.

subaccount.description: the unique id of a subaccount for this message - must already exist or will fail with an error

google_analytics_domains.description: an array of strings indicating for which any matching URLs will automatically have Google Analytics parameters appended to their query string automatically.

google_analytics_campaign.description: optional string indicating the value to set for the utm_campaign tracking parameter. If this isn't provided the email's from address will be used instead.

metadata.description: metadata an associative array of user metadata. Mandrill will store this metadata and make it available for retrieval. In addition, you can select up to 10 metadata fields to index and make searchable using the Mandrill search api.

recipient_metadata.description: Per-recipient metadata that will override the global values specified in the metadata parameter.

attachments.description: an array of supported attachments to add to the message

type.description: the MIME type of the attachment

name.description: the file name of the attachment

content.description: the content of the attachment as a base64-encoded string

images.description: an array of embedded images to add to the message

type.description: the MIME type of the image - must start with "image/"

name.description: the content ID of the image - used to reference the image in your HTML content

content.description: the content of the image as a base64-encoded string

id.description: a scheduled email id, as returned by any of the messages/send calls or messages/list-scheduled

send_at.description: the new UTC timestamp when the message should sent. Mandrill can't time travel, so if you specify a time in past the message will be sent immediately

query.description: search terms to find matching messages

tags.description: an array of tag names to narrow the search to

senders.description: an array of sender addresses to narrow the search to

api_keys.description: an array of API keys to narrow the search to

limit.description: the maximum number of results to return, defaults to 100, upper limit of 1000

query.description: the search terms to find matching messages for

tags.description: an array of tag names to narrow the search to, will return messages that contain ANY of the tags

senders.description: an array of sender addresses to narrow the search to, will return messages sent by ANY of the senders

raw_message.description: the full MIME document of an email message

from_email.description: optionally define the sender address - otherwise we'll use the address found in the provided headers

to.description: optionally define the recipient to receive the message - otherwise we'll use the To, Cc, and Bcc headers provided in the document

async.description: enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

ip_pool.description: the name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

send_at.description: when this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately; for future dates, you're limited to one year from the date of scheduling.

return_path_domain.description: a custom domain to use for the messages' return-path

message.description: the information on the message to send

async.description: enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

ip_pool.description: the name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

send_at.description: when this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately; for future dates, you're limited to one year from the date of scheduling.

template_name.description: the immutable slug of a template that exists in the user's account. Make sure you don't use the template name as this one might change.

template_content.description: an array of template content to send. Each item in the array should be a struct with two keys - name: the name of the content block to set the content for, and content: the actual content to put into the block

name.description: the name of the mc:edit editable region to inject into

message.description: the other information on the message to send - same as /messages/send, but without the html content

async.description: enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

ip_pool.description: the name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

send_at.description: when this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately; for future dates, you're limited to one year from the date of scheduling.

RejectAddRequest.description: Request payload for adding an email to the rejection blacklist

example.comment: Manually blocked due to spam complaints

comment.description: An optional comment describing the rejection
comment.example: Manually blocked due to spam complaints

subaccount.description: An optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the blacklist entry

RejectDeleteRequest.description: Request payload for deleting an email from the rejection blacklist

email.description: An email address to remove from the blacklist

subaccount.description: An optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the blacklist deletion

RejectListRequest.description: Request payload for retrieving email rejection blacklist

email.description: An optional email address to search by

include_expired.description: Whether to include rejections that have already expired

subaccount.description: An optional unique identifier for the subaccount to limit the blacklist

DomainRequest.description: Request body for operations requiring a domain name.

TagNameRequest.description: Request payload for tag operations requiring a tag name

AddWebhookRequest.description: Request payload for creating a new webhook.

example.description: My webhook for tracking email events

url.description: The URL to POST batches of events

description.description: An optional description of the webhook

events.description: Optional list of event types that will trigger the webhook

UpdateWebhookRequest.description: Request payload for updating an existing webhook.

id.description: The unique identifier of a webhook belonging to this account

url.description: The URL to POST batches of events

description.description: An optional description of the webhook

events.description: Optional list of event types that will trigger the webhook

WebhookIdRequest.description: Request payload for webhook operations requiring only ID.

id.description: The unique identifier of a webhook belonging to this account

AllowlistAddResponse.description: Response for adding an email to the allowlist

AllowlistDeleteResponse.description: Response for removing an email from the allowlist

email.description: The email address that was removed from the allowlist

deleted.description: Whether the address was deleted successfully

AllowlistListResponse.description: Response containing up to 1000 allowlist entries

email.description: The email address that is allowlisted

detail.description: A description of why the email was allowlisted

created_at.description: When the email was added to the allowlist

ExportJob.description: Export job creation response with initial status information

id.description: Unique identifier for this export job. Use this identifier when checking the export job status

created_at.description: Date and time the export job was created in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

type.description: Type of export job that was started

finished_at.description: Date and time the export job finished in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format, or null for jobs that have not run

state.description: Current state of the export job

result_url.description: URL to download the export results when job is complete, or null if not ready

ExportResponse.description: Export job information including status and download URL when complete

id.description: Unique identifier for this export job

created_at.description: Date and time the export job was created in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

finished_at.description: Date and time the export job finished in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format, or null if not finished

state.description: Current state of the export job

result_url.description: URL to download the export results when job is complete, or null if not ready

CustomDNSCheckResponse.description: Validation results for custom DNS domain configuration

valid.description: Whether the domain name has a correctly-configured A record pointing to the IP address

error.description: If valid is false, this will contain details about why the domain's A record is incorrect

DedicatedIPPoolResponse.description: Information about a dedicated IP pool including all IPs in the pool

name.description: This pool's name

created_at.description: The date and time that this pool was created as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

ips.description: The dedicated IPs in this pool

DedicatedIPResponse.description: Information about a dedicated IP address including warmup status and custom DNS configuration

created_at.description: The date and time that the dedicated IP was created as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

pool.description: The name of the pool that this dedicated IP belongs to

domain.description: The domain name (reverse DNS) of this dedicated IP

custom_dns.description: Information about the IP's custom DNS configuration

enabled.description: Whether custom DNS has been configured for this IP

valid.description: Whether the IP's custom DNS is currently valid

error.description: If the IP's custom DNS is invalid, this will include details about the error

warmup.description: Information about the IP's warmup status

IPDeleteResponse.description: Response for dedicated IP deletion operation

ip.description: The IP address that was deleted

deleted.description: Whether the IP was successfully deleted

IPProvisionResponse.description: Response for dedicated IP provisioning request

requested_at.description: The date and time that the request was created as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.fraction] format

IPWarmupStatus.description: Information about an IP's warmup status and schedule

warming_up.description: Whether the IP is currently in warmup mode

start_at.description: The start time for the warmup process as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

end_at.description: The end date and time for the warmup process as a UTC string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

PoolDeleteResponse.description: Response for dedicated IP pool deletion operation

pool.description: The name of the pool that was deleted

deleted.description: Whether the pool was successfully deleted

SendRawResponse.description: Response from processing raw MIME message

oneOf.description: Array of processing results showing matched routes

email.description: The email address that was processed

pattern.description: The route pattern that matched this email

url.description: The webhook URL where this message was sent

oneOf.description: Null when no recipients are processed or message is invalid

MessageContentResponse.title: MessageContentResponse
MessageContentResponse.description: The parsed content of a message

name.description: The recipient name

text.description: The text content of the message

html.description: The full HTML content of the message

name.description: The attachment filename

type.description: The MIME type of the attachment

MessageInfoResponse.title: MessageInfoResponse
MessageInfoResponse.description: Detailed information about a sent email message

smtp_events.description: SMTP events related to the message

subaccount.description: The subaccount used to send the message

reject.description: Rejection details if message was rejected

bounce_description.description: Description of bounce/rejection reason (only present for rejected messages)

MessageParseResponse.title: MessageParseResponse
MessageParseResponse.description: The parsed components of a raw MIME message

text.description: The text content of the message

text_flowed.description: Whether the text content uses format=flowed

name.description: The attachment filename

type.description: The MIME type of the attachment

name.description: The recipient name

send_at.description: When the message is scheduled to be sent

MessageSearchTimeSeriesResponse.title: MessageSearchTimeSeriesResponse
MessageSearchTimeSeriesResponse.description: Time series data point for message search results

time.description: The hour that the statistic occurred

sent.description: The number of emails sent during the time period

opens.description: The number of emails opened during the time period

clicks.description: The number of clicks during the time period

hard_bounces.description: The number of hard bounces during the time period

soft_bounces.description: The number of soft bounces during the time period

rejects.description: The number of emails rejected during the time period

complaints.description: The number of spam complaints during the time period

unsubs.description: The number of unsubscribes during the time period

unique_opens.description: The number of unique opens during the time period

unique_clicks.description: The number of unique clicks during the time period

MessagesSendResponse.title: MessagesSendResponse
MessagesSendResponse.description: The sending results for a single recipient

email.description: The email address of the recipient

status.description: The sending status of the recipient

reject_reason.description: The reason for the rejection if the recipient status is rejected

queued_reason.description: The reason for the queuing if the recipient status is queued

RejectAddResponse.description: Response for adding an email to the rejection blacklist

RejectDeleteResponse.description: Response for deleting an email from the rejection blacklist

email.description: The email address that was removed from the blacklist

deleted.description: Whether the address was deleted successfully

subaccount.description: The subaccount blacklist that the address was removed from, if any

RejectListResponse.description: Response containing up to 1000 rejection blacklist entries

reason.description: The type of event that caused this rejection

detail.description: Extended details about the event, such as the SMTP diagnostic for bounces or the comment for manually-created rejections

created_at.description: When the email was added to the blocklist

last_event_at.description: The timestamp of the most recent event that either created or renewed this rejection

expires_at.description: When the blocklist entry will expire (this may be in the past)

expired.description: Whether the blocklist entry has expired

sender.description: The sender that this blocklist entry applies to, or null if none

created_at.description: The date and time that the sender was first seen by Mandrill as a UTC date string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

sent.description: The total number of messages sent by this sender

hard_bounces.description: The total number of hard bounces by messages by this sender

soft_bounces.description: The total number of soft bounces by messages by this sender

rejects.description: The total number of rejected messages by this sender

complaints.description: The total number of spam complaints received for messages by this sender

unsubs.description: The total number of unsubscribe requests received for messages by this sender

subaccount.description: The subaccount that this denylist entry applies to, or null if none

example.detail: Manually blocked due to spam complaints

DomainVerification.description: Result of a sender domain verification email request.

SenderHourStat.description: Hourly stats row for a sender over the last 30 days.

SenderInfo.description: Detailed sender info including time-window stats.

SubaccountInfoResponse.description: Complete subaccount information including sending statistics and configuration (returned by info endpoint)

sent_hourly.description: Number of emails the subaccount has sent in the last hour

hourly_quota.description: Current hourly quota for the subaccount, either manual or reputation-based

notes.description: Optional extra text to associate with the subaccount

first_sent_at.description: Date and time the subaccount first sent an email in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

last_30_days.description: Sending statistics for this subaccount in the last 30 days

SubaccountResponse.description: Basic subaccount information returned by most operations (add, update, delete, pause, resume, list)

id.description: Unique identifier for the subaccount

name.description: Optional display name for the subaccount

created_at.description: Date and time the subaccount was created in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

status.description: Current sending status of the subaccount

reputation.description: Subaccount reputation on a scale from 0 to 100

sent_weekly.description: Number of emails the subaccount has sent so far this week (weeks start on midnight Monday, UTC)

sent_monthly.description: Number of emails the subaccount has sent so far this month (months start on midnight of the 1st, UTC)

sent_total.description: Number of emails the subaccount has sent since it was created

custom_quota.description: Optional manual hourly quota for the subaccount. Only present when explicitly set during creation/update

DeletedTagResponse.description: Response containing information about a deleted tag including its final statistics

tag.description: The name of the tag that was deleted

sent.description: Total number of emails sent with this tag before deletion

hard_bounces.description: Total number of hard bounces for emails with this tag before deletion

soft_bounces.description: Total number of soft bounces for emails with this tag before deletion

rejects.description: Total number of rejected emails with this tag before deletion

complaints.description: Total number of spam complaints for emails with this tag before deletion

unsubs.description: Total number of unsubscribe requests for emails with this tag before deletion

opens.description: Total number of times emails with this tag were opened before deletion

clicks.description: Total number of tracked URLs clicked in emails with this tag before deletion

unique_opens.description: Total number of unique opens for emails with this tag before deletion

unique_clicks.description: Total number of unique clicks for emails with this tag before deletion

reputation.description: Final reputation score of the tag before deletion

Tag.description: Tag information including sending statistics and reputation metrics

user_id.description: User ID associated with this tag

sent.description: Total number of emails sent with this tag

hard_bounces.description: Total number of hard bounces for emails with this tag

soft_bounces.description: Total number of soft bounces for emails with this tag

rejects.description: Total number of rejected emails with this tag

complaints.description: Total number of spam complaints for emails with this tag

unsubs.description: Total number of unsubscribe requests for emails with this tag

opens.description: Total number of times emails with this tag have been opened

clicks.description: Total number of tracked URLs clicked in emails with this tag

content_reviews.description: Number of content reviews for this tag

content_rejections.description: Number of content rejections for this tag

reject_resets.description: Number of reject resets for this tag

unique_opens.description: Total number of unique opens for emails with this tag

unique_clicks.description: Total number of unique clicks for emails with this tag

TagInfo.description: Detailed tag information including aggregate statistics across different time windows

sent.description: Total number of emails sent with this tag

hard_bounces.description: Total number of hard bounces for emails with this tag

soft_bounces.description: Total number of soft bounces for emails with this tag

rejects.description: Total number of rejected emails with this tag

complaints.description: Total number of spam complaints for emails with this tag

unsubs.description: Total number of unsubscribe requests for emails with this tag

opens.description: Total number of times emails with this tag have been opened

clicks.description: Total number of tracked URLs clicked in emails with this tag

unique_opens.description: Total number of unique opens for emails with this tag

unique_clicks.description: Total number of unique clicks for emails with this tag

stats.description: Aggregate summary of the tag's sending stats across different time windows

TagTimeSeries.description: Hourly statistics for a tag in a specific time period

sent.description: Number of emails sent during the hour

hard_bounces.description: Number of emails that hard bounced during the hour

soft_bounces.description: Number of emails that soft bounced during the hour

rejects.description: Number of emails rejected during the hour

complaints.description: Number of spam complaints received during the hour

unsubs.description: Number of unsubscribe requests received during the hour

opens.description: Number of emails opened during the hour

unique_opens.description: Number of unique opens generated by messages sent during the hour

clicks.description: Number of tracked URLs clicked during the hour

unique_clicks.description: Number of unique clicks generated by messages sent during the hour

time.description: The hour as a UTC date string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

TagTimeSeriesWithTag.description: Hourly statistics for a tag in a specific time period, including the tag name

tag.description: Tag name for this time series entry

time.description: Hour as a UTC date string in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

sent.description: Number of emails sent during the hour

hard_bounces.description: Number of emails that hard bounced during the hour

soft_bounces.description: Number of emails that soft bounced during the hour

rejects.description: Number of emails that were rejected during the hour

complaints.description: Number of spam complaints received during the hour

opens.description: Number of emails opened during the hour

unique_opens.description: Number of unique opens generated by messages sent during the hour

clicks.description: Number of tracked URLs clicked during the hour

unique_clicks.description: Number of unique clicks generated by messages sent during the hour

TemplateRenderResponse.description: Result of rendering a template with content and merge variables

html.description: Rendered HTML as a string with content and merge variables injected

TemplateResponse.description: Template information including content, metadata, and settings

slug.description: Immutable unique identifier for the template

name.description: Human-readable name of the template

labels.description: Array of labels for filtering templates

code.description: Draft HTML code for the template with mc:edit attributes

publish_code.description: Published HTML code for the template

published_at.description: Date and time when template was last published in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

created_at.description: Date and time when template was created in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

updated_at.description: Date and time when template was last updated in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

draft_updated_at.description: Date and time when template draft was last updated in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

is_broken_template.description: Whether the template has broken syntax or references

User.description: Authenticated user account information including sending stats

created_at.description: Account creation date in UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format

public_id.description: Unique permanent identifier for this user

reputation.description: User reputation on scale 0-100, 75+ is generally good

backlog.description: Number of emails queued due to quota limits

stats.description: Aggregate sending statistics across different time windows

WebhookResponse.description: Webhook configuration for receiving event notifications.

id.description: Unique identifier for the webhook

url.description: The URL where webhook events will be posted

auth_key.description: The key used for webhook authentication

events.description: Array of event types that will trigger the webhook

last_sent_at.description: When the last event was sent to this webhook (UTC YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)

batches_sent.description: Number of batches sent to this webhook

events_sent.description: Total number of events sent to this webhook

last_error.description: Last error message received when attempting to call the webhook

ts.description: Unix timestamp when the event occurred

state.description: The state of the SMS event

text.description: The SMS message content to be sent

to.description: The phone number to send the SMS to

from.description: The phone number to send the SMS from.

consent.description: The consent type for this SMS

track_clicks.description: whether or not to turn on click tracking for the message

sms_events.description: SMS events related to the message

SmsSendResponse.title: SmsSendResponse
